core_constraints.name: bilinear_consistency
core_constraints.description: For every unit square, the two triangulation-based linear interpolation methods must yield identical depth values at all interior points. This enforces that d(A) + d(C) = d(B) + d(D) for each square with corners A,B,C,D in clockwise order.

core_constraints.name: non_negative_depth
core_constraints.description: All grid point depths must be non-negative (d(p) >= 0 for all p).

core_constraints.name: unique_known_points
core_constraints.description: Each (x, y) coordinate appears at most once in the known depth data.

objective.description: Minimize the depth value at the treasure location (t_x, t_y), or output 'impossible' if no valid extension exists.

invariant.name: grid_linear_constraint_system
invariant.description: The consistency condition d(A)+d(C)=d(B)+d(D) over all unit squares induces a system of linear equations that can be modeled as a graph with parity constraints or as a potential function over a bipartite grid.
